c74object.name: orchidea.solution.tofile
c74object.digest: Get filenames for a specific orchidea solution
c74object.description: Receives the output of orchidea.solve and returns the audio and text filenames of the solutions.

inlet.description: The first inlet receives the solution information coming from orchidea.solve's first outlet.

Second inlet receives a list containing the segment and solution indices. If the number 0 (as a single integer) is received instead, the global connection is imported (default). If a single number greater than 0 is received, it is considered as a segment number and all solutions for that segment are output.

outlet.description: Outputs the solution text file (this file will contain information on all solutions for a given segment, or for the connection)

objarg.name: segmentnumber
objarg.description: The optional second argument sets the segment number. Use 0 to output the connection (default).

objarg.name: solutionnumber
objarg.description: The optional third argument sets the solution number.

method.name: list
method.digest: Import solution to buffer or set indices
method.description:
Left inlet should be connected to the leftmost output of a orchidea.solve object, that will send the need information about all the solutions (prefix, number of segments and number of solutions for each segment).
Right inlet expects either 0 (meaning: get files for the connection, default), or a single number (meaning: get all files for a given segment) or two numbers: a segment number and a solution number (meaning: get a specific solution for a specific segment).
When the left inlet list is received, the full path to the text and audio files is output respectively from right and left inlet.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (list)
entry.description: Solution information. The first inlet receives the solution information coming from orchidea.solve's first outlet.

entry.name: Inlet 2 (int/list)
entry.description: Segment and solution indices. Second inlet receives a list containing the segment and solution indices. If the number 0 (as a single integer) is received instead, the global connection is imported (default). If a single number greater than 0 is received, it is considered as a segment number and all solutions for that segment are output.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (bang)
entry.description: Audio File(s). Outputs the solution audio file(s)

entry.name: Outlet 2 (bang)
entry.description: Text File. Outputs the solution text file (this file will contain information on all solutions for a given segment, or for the connection)
